poem:
Title: "Striking Notes on a Morning's Press"

Shadows stand, populous and restless,
Striking for worth in a pennied dawn.
A tempest in teacups, we thread the needle's eye -
UK, you're a turning point poem,
Pouring out verses of moneyed rise. 

Ultra-long mortgages, cryptic sequels,
Echo against satin walls of wealth and awaiting.
In Jobcentre queues, faces turn into paragraphs,
Voicing unheard sonnets for the honour of labour.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK economy at turning point as output rises; ‘shocking’ rise in ultra-long mortgages – business live 9.59am BST Jobcentre security guards strike over pay Jobcentre security guards across the UK are on strike today in a dispute over pay, PA Media reports. The GMB said more than 1,000 of its members employed by G4S for the Department for Work and Pensions walked out for the day. The union said more than two thirds of the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
